article.headline: Portland St. 100, Sacramento St. 73
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Deonte Huff came off the bench to score 23 points and grab 10 rebounds, leading Portland State to a 100-73 win over Sacramento State on Thursday. Scott Morrison added 16 points, nine rebounds and five blocked shots for Portland State (17-12, 8-7). Juma Kamara and Anthony Washington had 14 points apiece for the Vikings, who remained in the hunt for a bid to the Big Sky Tournament. Alex Bausley led Sacramento State (9-18, 4-10) with 20 points. Haron Hargrave added 12 points for the Hornets, who shot 37 percent from the floor. Portland State ran off a 14-0 run early in the game and led 20-5 after Huff slammed down an ally-oop pass from Paul Hafford with 12:27 left in the first half. The Vikings extended their lead to 26-8 on another Huff dunk and led by as many as 22 points in the first half. Sacramento State got as close as nine points in the second half, but never seriously challenged the Vikings. Portland State shot 54 percent from the field and outrebounded the Hornets 48-31. The Vikings also tied the school record with 10 blocked shots.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
